credit_line: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
title: Sampler
medium:
Medium: silk on wool
Technique: cross, satin, stem and chain stitches on plain weave foundation
description: Divided into three horizontal bands.  At the top a woman in an Empire dress holding a flower stands between flowering plants, birds and animals.  At the center a symmetrical arrangement of plants and birds.  At the bottom the following verse and signature: "Learn to contemn all praise betimes/ For flatt'ry is the nurse of crimes/ With early virtue plant thy breast/ The specious arts of vice detest/ Charlotte Payne Lloyd/ Aged 13 years June 29 1819."
name: Sampler
